quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The documentary series finished airing ages ago. Why is PBS sending another crew?

quotes.speaker: CameraMan
quotes.line: We’re getting bonus footage for the DVD.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: pff, Nobody buys DVDs anymore.

quotes.speaker: CameraMan
quotes.line: It’ll be a pledge gift.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: PBS. The propaganda wing of Bill and Melinda Gates and viewers like you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: In the past year, I have consolidated the entire Scranton paper market. We regained the white pages, the school district, Lackawanna county. We supply them all. I’m getting married tomorrow afternoon, and in the morning, there’s a mini-reunion. A kind of a “where are they now” panel at a local theatre. It’ll be nice to see everyone again. [laughs] I haven’t seen Kevin since we let him go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [mimicking trumpet] Today marks several important milestones. Stanley, as you know, is retiring.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes! Whoo, whoo, whoo!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Ah, I’ve been looking forward to this day since I was 18 years old.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Speech!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! And our next and most thickly frosted cake is…for…Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes! Wait, why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Go ahead and just read the frosting.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: “Get out.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It’s a colloquial way of saying “you’re fired,” Kevin, which you are.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What? Dwight, you can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The cake has spoken Pam. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well if anyone here can make a case for Kevin staying.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Dwight…[overlapping objections]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Based…on his merit.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Umm….

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I’m…good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, Toby will stop it. Anytime anyone’s ever been fired, Toby’s blocked it, so…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah. Yeah, I don’t think…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Toby, wait. Wait. Hold that thought. Here’s your cake.  [squirts frosting on the top] Bye, bye Toby.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [crying] At least I got chocolate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I bike to work now. Saves on gas, cheaper than a vasectomy and, uh, oh, yeah, it’s good for the environment too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam and I are great. She just recently finished her mural for the Irish cultural center.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.line: Whoo! Yeah

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Cici] Can you clap! Can you clap for mom?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And Dwight is imitating Japanese business practices for reasons he explained to us in Japanese.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispering] Angela, are you ready for the wedding?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [whispering] Yes. My heart is so open, I am so at peace. [scoffs] Look at Meredith. She’s disgusting. Those feet. They’re like the paws of an orangutan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think she looks good. Now that she’s wearing sports bras, we don’t see her boobs as much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That is all. Have a good morning.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [after Angela kisses Dwight] What was that for?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [laughing] To remind you that our wedding’s gonna be wonderful.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ah. I know. It just feels so empty with so many of the old gang gone.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: D, it’s gonna be perfect. The only people that need to be there are you and me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, and the old man to feed us the cheese that he’s been fermenting since the day of my birth.  You keep forgetting about him.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don’t…I don’t know why.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I brought in some new faces, and one old. I always like Devon. I hired him back after Creed faked his own death in the baler the day after the doc aired. The only person he fooled was Kevin. Then the police showed up. Turns out, Creed was in the band “The Grass Roots” in the 1960’s. During that time, the police say he sold drugs and trafficked in endangered species meat and stole weapons-grade LSD from the military.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, some fudge?

quotes.speaker: Malcolm
quotes.line: Oh, thanks. I love your fudge.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Malcolm
quotes.line: I think I gained a couple of pounds since I got here.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [laughing] Oh, you can afford it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: After 16 years, it’s strange sitting across from somebody who isn’t Stanley. But…he’ll get there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, the limo’s gonna be here at five.  I need everybody to be ready ‘cause I want to pack in a lot.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Party time! Whorehouse!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, no. No whorehouse. This is Dwight’s night, okay?

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Well, you’re the bestisch mensch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight has made me his bestisch mensch. Which is Schrute for best man. He’s putting himself entirely in my hands tonight. And I know for over 12 years I’ve done nothing but trick and prank him but tonight…only good surprises. “Guten Pranken”. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh hey, Jim. I forgot to mention. Oftentimes, in Hollywood portrayals of bachelor parties, there are accidental murders. That won’t be necessary tonight.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Great, now we got three hours to fill.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, hold on. Are you sure Mose isn’t going to show up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ever since Angela moved in and Mose had to stop sleeping at the foot of my bed, he’s been acting pretty weird about this whole wedding thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mose has been weird? That’s so unlike him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, sure, I’ll talk about it. Why not? American’s next A Cappella Sensation aired my audition. And when I started sobbing uncontrollably, apparently that struck a chord with quite a lot of people. Not a very compassionate chord. The clip went viral, as they say

quotes.speaker: Casey Dean
quotes.line: You can’t just sit here and cry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, I can so just sit here and cry!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Two million hits in the first week and then the parodies started. One from the Philippines got 12 million hits. And the late night comedy guys had a field day with it.

quotes.speaker: Bill Hader
quotes.line: [fake crying]

quotes.speaker: Seth Mayers
quotes.line: Oh, Don’t. Aw, come on, Baby Wawa. Don’t be such a baby.

quotes.speaker: Bill Hader
quotes.line: [crying and pouring eye drops in his eyes]

quotes.speaker: Seth Mayers
quotes.line: Oh, No. It’s gonna be alright.

quotes.speaker: Bill Hader
quotes.line: [pulling multiple tissues out]

quotes.speaker: Seth Mayers
quotes.line: It’s gonna be all right. For Weekend Update I’m Seth Meyers. That’s Baby Wawa. Good night.

quotes.speaker: Bill Hader
quotes.line: [still crying] Bye!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: After my clip blew up, I actually got a call from the double rainbow guy and the fat Star Wars kid. Turns out they have a support group. [pause] Not really my scene.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [on the phone] Years ago, the senator promised a left turn lane by the Arby’s. So I wanna know where in the name of horsey sauce is it? Well, yeah, you…hold on.

quotes.speaker: Dakota
quotes.line: Hi. I keep seeing this symbol in the accounts from last year. It’s..it’s all over the place. I don’t know what it means.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: That’s the reason Kevin got fired. It’s his magic number. He used to use it to balance his accounts. He used to call it a Keleven. He told Dwight, [imitating Kevin] “A mistake plus Keleven gets you home by seven.” He was home by 4:45 that day.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, I live in Poland now. The Scranton of the E.U. Thank you for flying me out here for the weekend. I’m looking forward to the reunion panel tomorrow. Can’t wait to see everyone. Well, almost everyone.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hello! [laughing] Hello!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hi! [goes to hug Nellie]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh. [laughs nervously]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: How did you now my plane had arrived? How long have you been stalking me?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, no, no. no. My plane just got in. From New York. Are you still with Piotr?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: No. And I thought I unfriended you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Anyone can follow a Twitter feed. Wanna share a cab?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [alone in cab} After Dwight fired me, I moved to New York to write the great American novel. I have six roommates. Heh. Which are better than friends, you know ‘cause they have to give you one month’s notice before they leave.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey-OH!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You’re back?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Malcolm
quotes.line: [whispering to Phyllis] That’s Baby Wawa, right? Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey man, good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you. Yeah,

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [hugging Andy]. Andy…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey! Aw! A bear hug from my favorite mama grizzly.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Andy, I’ve been worried about you. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: A little warm.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Poor, poor Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [struggling] Okay. Aw. Thank you Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hello, hello.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Darryl!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey, what’s up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Didn’t I just see you at the airport jumping in a limo?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: What? Must’ve been another devilishly handsome debonair individual.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey, man. How are you doing? I, um…I didn’t call ‘cause I figured you changed the number.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No I didn’t change the number. All good though. Phone never rings.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What? Ooh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Surprise!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I thought you guys couldn’t come.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, but then they moved the panel to the same weekend and the Doc crew paid to fly us in. It was kismet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Kismet? Yeah, right. Pam and I came up with excuses for every other weekend. You remember my two lap band surgeries, right? Neither do I? “Guten Prank” number one.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You ready for tonight? We gonna tear up the town?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh, better ask Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And Jim will say nothing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [enters] Darryl! Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey! Pam!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey, Pam! How are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We’re fine. Yeah. [hugs both Darryl and Andy] And I’m sure that you guys are fine too. Because why wouldn’t you be?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Darryl, oh, my gosh. How is Austin? Tell me everything. How’s the merger? I feel like I read about Athlead all the time.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I love it. And it’s Athleap now. And the city is amazing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah. Yeah, it’s hot. The music is awesome. And the tacos are…for real.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow! That sounds incredible. [checking cell phone]. Oh, guys. Limo’s here. Let’s do this. Change if you need to.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Whoo, whoo, whoo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, you guys, have fun. You too, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Aw!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Woah-Oh! Haven’t been in one of these in forever.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: They wanted me to go to the bachelorette party with the girls. Really? Such a cliché. I’m a man. So I’m going to the bachelor party with the boys. I just have to remember how I acted before I came out.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: WASSUUUUP! [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, why are we stopping? Jim, this isn’t on the itinerary.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Get out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim…wha… Come on! What…what are you gonna whack me, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, Dwight. You’ll be doing the whacking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: A bazooka. You remembered.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Of course I did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [tearful laugh]. Get out of my way.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: OH! [all laugh and applaud after Dwight fires the bazooka]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Woo! Okay!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah! [to camera] Guten Prank number two.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Private Room.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah, brosef.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Amazing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Enjoy, enjoy.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.line: Hey, I know you. Are you gonna sit here and cry?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, man, easy.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.line: [fake cries]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, dude, leave him alone. What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Jim, it’s fine. He’ll just get you on his cell phone and then that’ll go viral.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That happens a lot?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, I guess. But things are going well actually. I spoke at Cornell during commencement week. I mean, the seniors invited me as a joke but it was a huge success.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well, I bet it was a smash.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That’s how I got my new job in the admissions office.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Is that a volunteer program or…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. It’s a job. Things are going great.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Let’s get a drink in you, huh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Whoo-hoo. Let’s get this party started!

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Where’s my angel.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: This is my big sister Rachel.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: No, this is my big sister Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [laughs] We’re very close. We even have our own special language.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: [speaks in a special language]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: People love it.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: They do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sighs] Man, how long have we been sitting here?

quotes.speaker: Stripper
quotes.line: Hi, boys!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Ohh…

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Here we go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, Thank God. We are famished!

quotes.speaker: Stripper
quotes.line: Hey, did somebody order the chef special?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Right there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, we haven’t ordered anything. No one’s even taken our drinks. Uh, what is the chef special?  [music plays and stripper starts dancing on Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Stripper
quotes.line: I bet you boys have a big appetite.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, we do. So we’ll have an onion loaf for the table, please. And tell us about your heartiest soups.

quotes.speaker: Stripper
quotes.line: Mm, I know what you want. I know exactly what you want.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, an onion loaf for the table but that’s not all. Now the chef special sounded good. What is it exactly?

quotes.speaker: Stripper
quotes.line: Ohh, shh. [places finger over Dwight’s lips]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, what are you doing? Are you giving me a taste of the chef’s special? Tastes like cigarettes. That won’t work. That’s no good.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What? [knock at the door] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, boy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Jakey
quotes.line: Heard you guys needed some pipes fixed or cleaned or whatever.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Angela’s special repairman is here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Wait, what is this?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Shut up. Jakey?

quotes.speaker: Jakey
quotes.line: Mom?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wait, wait. What?

quotes.speaker: Jakey
quotes.line: Oh, man.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No, no, no, no. Just do your wok. Pretend mom’s not here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, that seems inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Give the good show, my little entrepreneur.

quotes.speaker: Jakey
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Take it off. [music play]. Yeah! Good song choice, Jakey. Stripper’s only as good as his song.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: oh, wowee wow.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Whoo-hoo…go, Meredith’s stripper son.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Rachel, are you all right?

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: I don’t know!  I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh geeze. [Jakey starts dancing on Angela]. Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Be gentle Jakey. Gentle. One second. Just one second. Look. [pushes Jakey aside and starts dancing on Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay, if anything, this is rougher. Stop it Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Fine. My bad. Go ahead Jakey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [Jakey resumes dancing] Uh, no. It’s o…thank you. You know what? You don’t have to…oh no, no, no. No, no, no. It’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Now, for the last time, I’d like a side salad with balsamic.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Dwight, for the last time, she’s not a waitress.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You’re telling me!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: If you want her to leave, just tip her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What for? We haven’t even gotten bread yet. Does anyone wanna split a twice baked potato? [to the dancing stripper] Do you have those? Those aren’t deep fried, right?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: That was interesting. [creaking sound] What was that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It’s just the wind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Will you lock the door?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Okay. [opens door] It’s just the wind, see? Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Alright, see, you don’t have to leave the door wide open. We get it. It’s the wind. Just come and shut…[Mose grabs Angela and takes her away] OH! My God!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: [screams]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: What’s happening?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, man, never thought I’d say this but I think I ate too much bone marrow. [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, it’s the girls. Hey Pam. What? Angela’s been kidnapped! Phyllis left the door open and some freak came and grabbed her and fled.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good old Mose. [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: They think it was Mose.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, great. He’s getting into the spirit of the festivities. Fantastic. He just pulled off a Braut Entfuhrung.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: A ceremonial bridal kidnapping. He will take the bride and hide her at a local pub and when I find the place, I have to buy everyone drinks. Ah, all right! Oh Mose.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait a minute. You said the tradition is for the groom is search for her and it ends at a pub. So how about the last pub you’d ever set foot in in this town?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Right. Which one is that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm, hey driver. Why don’t you take us to 3030 Adams?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is that Mose?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, it is! I am here for my bride!

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.line: Well, first, buy us a drink.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: If you want your bride, buy us a drink! If you want your bride, buy us a drink.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Very well! Drinks on me! Bartender!  [Kevin turns around] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Well, well, well, well, well, well. That’s six “wells.” Did I get that number right, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I heard you bought a bar, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes. I did. This one. Now get out!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [to Mose] Why did you pick this place? [Mose points to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You? You did this as a prank. My own Bestich Mensch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nope, not a prank. I think it’s time for you to bury the hatchet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Waste of a good hatchet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, just talk.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Well, w…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I heard you say “well” the first time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I know Dwight misses Kevin. I saw him make his portrait out of a Wooly Willy. Tomorrow’s his wedding day. You can’t be anything but happy on your wedding day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It was nothing personal. It’s just that you were terrible at your job.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You’re just saying that to make me feel better.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No really. You were terrible at math and organization, time management, personal hygiene. Your internet searches were so filthy we had to throw our your computer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Is that all it was?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That’s it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Come here [hugs Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I missed you Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I missed you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ohh.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.line: Guten Prank.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes, Mose. Guten Prank number three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You’ve had your drink. Now where is my bride?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mose! What..ooh, Mose. [Mose opens trunk]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What the [bleep] is your problem you [bleep] [bleep] [bleep]?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey. Hey, is Angela coming or…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. We can’t see each other on our wedding day. And her legs are still numb from being in the trunk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: How’s Florida?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Yes, I’m living in Florida now. Little town called Florida City, just on the edge of the everglades. The man who delivered my divorce papers came by fan boat which was kinda fun. I sit on my porch all day, carving birds.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Am I the only one that’s nervous? How are you doing with this? Should we have bailed?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, no, I’m fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Doesn’t seem like anyone cares about us anyway.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I guess this was work being filmed nonstop for nine years.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m sorry guys. This is probably on me. I got hated on pretty hard when that auto-tune went viral.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [watching at his bar] People actually dance to this. It’s in my juke box. None of the money goes to Andy though.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [laughing] Yeah, people hate you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’ll go talk to the manager. Maybe we should just go home. [walks down the hall]

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Hey! It’s Andy Bernard!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Nard Dog! [cheers and claps] Ree-De-De-De-Doo! [repeats]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ree-De-De-De-Doo!

quotes.speaker: Man 1
quotes.line: How did it feel to see your lives played out on tv?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: It’s like seeing a documentary about how your food is made. It’s kinda disgusting. You learn a lot, but I didn’t wanna know any of it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: With today’s modern surveillance technology we are in a constant state of being watched weather it’s our government or the government of other countries a.k.a. Google. You guys are being filmed way more than we ever were.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Uh, no one recognizes me. But not all my friends call me Plop. So… thanks PBS.

quotes.speaker: Woman 1
quotes.line: Uh, Jim, that DVD in the last episode was so romantic. And, um, I think we’d all love to know, Pam, what romantic thing did you do to pay Jim back for leaving Athlead?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, I mean, How do you pay back someone for something like that? But, uh, I don’t know. I’m working on something.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: She pays me back every day just by being my wife so that’s fine.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Awww.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: O-Kay.

quotes.speaker: Woman 2
quotes.line: All I can say is, if I had Jim, he would have a free pass to do anything. I mean if I lucked into that… he could do anything. Anything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [pause] I’m sorry. Is there a question?

quotes.speaker: Woman 2
quotes.line: Uh, no.

quotes.speaker: Man 2
quotes.line: Pam, what was in that teapot letter?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, um, well, you know, I… I just… I just think I would rather keep that private. You know, if you’d been filmed for nine years of your life, there’d be some things that you just wanna keep to yourself.

quotes.speaker: Man 2
quotes.line: I hear ya. What did it say?

quotes.speaker: Moderator
quotes.line: We’re gonna move on. Next question please.

quotes.speaker: Man 3
quotes.line: Do you find that your life feels pointless now that nobody’s actually filming you anymore?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Woman 3
quotes.line: I wanna know how everyone felt they were portrayed. Was it accurate?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I got a beef with that. Um, for the first seven years, I was getting my PhD in School Psychology and they didn’t show it. Yes, I was getting hammered but, hey, it was college.

quotes.speaker: Woman 4
quotes.line: I have a question for Jim and Pam. Everyone watching sees how much you love each other and how you’re soul mates. So, Pam, how could you doubt that when Jim moved to Philadelphia?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Um, you know what, I actually didn’t handle that move, uh, very gracefully. From not communicating to being a little selfish.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Listen, um… I was scared, you know? I loved what I had, and I didn’t want to risk it. And I think that maybe I did doubt him a little too. Which was wrong because he’s shown me time and again. But when the documentary started airing, people on the street told me that I had this fairy-tale romance. But there were a lot of times last year where it did not feel like a fairy tale. But then it got deeper, and it got stronger and now it’s better than a fairy tale. It’s like a long book that you never want to end.  And you’re fine with that because you just never, ever wanna leave it.

quotes.speaker: Woman 4
quotes.line: Like Harry Potter.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, like Harry Potter.

quotes.speaker: Joan
quotes.line: I have a question for Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Joan
quotes.line: Yes. Um, the thing I found most compelling about the documentary was your search for your birth mother.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Joan
quotes.line: So my question is, um, do… don’t you hate her? I mean, I would just imagine that you were so angry at her that you would hate her.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Maybe sometimes. But not like “hate” hate. More just like, “Mom, I hate you!” And then she would say “go to your room, young lady.” And I’d stamp my foot and run upstairs and I have a room, which is really cool. And then we’d just have dinner together. But I don’t know. I’d have to meet her. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Joan
quotes.line: Erin…

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Joan
quotes.line: Um…Oh, Erin..

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes? Is there a follow-up question? [realizes] Mom? [they hug]

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.line: Erin… Same question but about your dad? [they hug]

quotes.speaker: Moderator
quotes.line: Well, this feels like a good place to stop. Let’s thank all of our wonderful panelists for being here on this wonderful panel today.  [audience claps] Next week at the Scranton Cultural Center don’t forget, Irish Step Dancing semifinals. Winning team to Mid-Atlantic. [applause and scattering cheers]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Where’s the, uh, basket for gifts?

quotes.speaker: Usher
quotes.line: Right there, sir.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dakota
quotes.line: Hi, I’m Dakota.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Jeff Bomondo. I sell ceramic tile out of Newark.

quotes.speaker: Dakota
quotes.line: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: My wife’s name is Kathryn. I can show you my social security card if it helps.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Uck, Look at all this mud. Can you imagine if I had worn my Jimmy Choos? I just saved you 600 bucks mister.

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.line: Thanks for helping out, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Kelly, you’re here.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Hey, Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Whose baby is this? Oh, are, like, a nanny now?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No, this little guy is mine.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: So I was dating this girl, and one day, she went out to get a new charger for her e-cigarette. Never came back. Oldest story in the book. [baby squeals]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Say “hi”, Drake.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Drake is your baby’s name?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: That is an amazing name. I’m obsessed with Drake. His last album… it just touched me to pieces.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No Kelly, he’s no named after a hip-hop artist from 2011. It’s Drake, like a mix of Drew and Blake.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Cool.  Well, he is so cute. Ravi, check out this cute baby. I’m obsessed with him. Ravi is a pediatrician and some of his patients are total uggos.

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.line: They’re called premature, sweetie. It’s good to see you again Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Let me help you us.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thanks. [knees buckle] Oh. Ouch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, boy. Maybe your heels are too high.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, my heels aren't too high. It’s because I spent three hours in a car trunk. Thanks for not locking the door when I asked you to, Phyllis. [sighs] Sorry Phyllis. You didn’t know. As long as I can get to the altar.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, I’m gonna get you to that altar. You can take that to the bank.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [chuckles] You kidding? I was born ready. [mimicking heavy metal guitars]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight, Dwight, Dwight. Um… I don’t know how to tell you this, but… we have a little bit of a problem.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, no. What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The minister just told me that it’s tradition for the Bestish Mensch to be older than the groom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, come on. I’ve never heard of such a thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I haven’t heard of it, obviously. But I’m out because I am significantly younger than you-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Not… significant is a big word…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think it’s definitely… Well, okay. Either way…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I think you’re only a teeny…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Either way, Dwight… I can’t be there for you. I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I just…really wish there was something I could do. [looks off]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [turns around] [whispering] Michael. I can’t believe you came.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That’s what she said.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Best prank ever.

quotes.speaker: Minister
quotes.line: As it is traditional to the Schrutes, the lovers are standing in their own graves as a reminder that this is the only escape from what they are about to do.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: [to Joan] See, I get what they are trying to do, but why are the graves so shallow?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [reading] “Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away. For lo, the winter is passed. The rain is over and gone. The time of singing has come and the voice of the turtledove is heard in our land. Let me see your face. Let me hear your voice for your voice is sweet and your face is comely. “

quotes.speaker: Minister
quotes.line: I now pronounce you man and wife. [everyone cheers] Release the doves! [doves do not move right away]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: That’s not…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ladies and gentlemen. Thank you so much for coming. Now, please take your hay bales to the reception. They’ll be used for seating. Complimentary hay hooks are placed alone the aisles. Just stab ‘em on in there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Everybody!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [dancing with Pam. They kiss] See, now you don’t owe me anything.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Ravi? Ravi? Drake has a bit of a rash. And he’s hot.

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.line: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I was wondering could you maybe examine him for a second?

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, you’re not feeling well little guy? Okay, sure. Should we go inside?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Actually, could you go inside? I’m feeling a little dehydrated. I could really use a little break, have some water.

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.line: Are you sure you don’t wanna go in?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Ravi, just do it. That baby is burning up. Isn’t this, like what you live for? Just go. Go.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Thank you Ravi. Thank you so much. This is great for me and for Drake. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I don’t know, Ryan. Baby Drake didn’t look so good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: He’ll be fine. I let me suck on a strawberry. He’s allergic but he’ll get over it fast. I had to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You gave your baby an allergic reaction just to talk to me? [they kiss]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael has so many pictures of his kids he had to get two phones with two numbers and he pays two bills.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [with Michael] Oh, my gosh, it’s choreographed!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He just so happy to have a family plan.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.line: Where’d you learn to dance like that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I don’t know. I’ve just always been really good at dancing.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [dancing with Pam] [sobbing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Is it me? Is it Nellie?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [sobbing] It’s everything.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [dancing with Stanley] I missed you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I missed you too.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Lots of people think that Stanley Hudson’s a mean old grump. [laughs] But [crying] would a grump make this? It’s me. It’s me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I love you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [laughing] I love you too.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: We’re gonna be together forever.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: We’re running off into the sunset.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I finally mastered commitment.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [to Oscar] What was that stuff?

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.line: Hey, has anyone seen Ryan… or Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ooh! Yes. Uh, They left together a little while ago. Kelly was hoping that you would keep the baby so they can start a new life together.

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.line: Oh, that’s it. Here. [hands Drake to Kevin] Call child services and report an abandoned baby. We’ll find a better parent than Ryan in no time.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Um, Kevin? Oh, I can help you with that. Yeah. I mean, I can find someone who will… who will love that beautiful little boy the way he deserves.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey, this is better. [hands Drake to Nellie]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yes. It is. Oh yes it is.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: If Ryan wants his baby back, please tell him where to fine me. We’ll be somewhere in Europe. [looking at Drake] Won’t we?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [crying] I feel like all my kids grew up and then they married each other. It’s every parent’s dream.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Thank you go much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good night.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: Great. It was really fun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good evening.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: The Doc crew’s throwing a big after party in the warehouse tonight.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, I heard. It sounds kinda lame. [to camera] No offense. You going, Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, I don’t know. I might turn in early.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It’s only 6:00. Come on, everybody’s going.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: You have to go, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Yeah, come on, Tobes.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah. I’ll stop by.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: There he is!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I need to get out of this dress.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I gotta get out of this dress.

quotes.speaker: Carol Stills
quotes.line: Oh, I’m sorry Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [sighs] [whispering] Why are you still here?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: [whispering] I’m so sorry. They were an hour late.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, really, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, Okay. Um… so… this past year has been really great, and you’ve been great and I just… I know that you had to make this choice and you had to give something up for me. But I never want you to have to give up anything. I just thought if I could get us an offer then there wouldn’t be anything standing in our way and I could come to you with this big Jim gesture… and show you all at once just how much I love you and how much I really do believe in your future.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry, how long have you been showing the house?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: About 2 months

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That’s why it’s so clean.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I mean, you were gonna do this without me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, you… you bought the house without telling me, so I thought I could sell it without telling you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh… okay. Where would we go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Austin? Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I promise you, you don’t have to do this for me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I’m doing it for us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The last…

quotes.speaker: Buyer
quotes.line: Okay. We’ll take it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to the buyer] Hold on a second. [to Pam] The last few months have meant the world to me and all I care about…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hold on a second. [turning] Wait, what did you just say?

quotes.speaker: Buyer
quotes.line: We wanna buy your house.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You wanna do this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I wanna do this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You really want to do this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I really want to do this!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [hugging Pam] [laughing] Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Darryl. [whispers in his ear]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: What? All right!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We’re so excited.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.line: Oh, that’s for PBS executives only.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I had to pledge $50 to my local PBS station just to get this.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: I think your ideas are fantastic, Oscar. I’d love to contribute to your campaign.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Thank you David.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, could I please have your attention? So a year ago, I got my first art commission to paint a mural for Dunder Mifflin and I decided to paint the history of paper…,which was just some trees and stuff. And then someone spray painted a bunch of butts on it and I had to start from the beginning. But it all worked out for the best because I think that I’ve painted the perfect thing which is the history of us. All of us. And this is for you Jim. [applause] And go ahead! [drape drops and everyone cheers]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Everyone, Let’s take our picture in front of the mural. Oh, um, I just…I kind of meant just everybody from the office.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.line: [taking pictures] Very nice. Just a couple dozen more. Smiles, everybody, smiles. All right, that’s great. I got enough. Thank you, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [whispering to Pam] Let’s go outside

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Okay, I need a drink.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, we all need a drink. [opening Meredith’s drawer] What the…there’s only dandelion tea and raisins in here.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey, bottom drawer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [answering the phone] Dunder Mifflin, This is Pam. Oh, I’m sorry. Jim Halpert doesn’t work here anymore.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I didn’t watch the whole documentary. After a few episodes, it was too painful. I kept wanting to scream at Pam. It took me so long to do so many important things. It’s just hard to accept that I spent so many years being less happy than I could have been. Jim was 5 feet from my desk and it took me four years to get to him. It’d be great if people saw this documentary and learned from my mistakes. Not that I’m a tragic person. I’m really happy now. But…it would just…just make my heart soar if someone out there saw this and she said to herself “be strong, trust yourself, love yourself. Conquer your fears. Just go after what you want and act fast, because life just isn’t that long.”

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: If there is one thing that I have learned through this whole experience, it’s that if you film anybody long enough, they’re going to do something stupid. It’s only human natural.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What about the honeymoon?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, the honeymoon can wait till tomorrow. We wanted to hang out with you guys. I mean, when are we all going to be here together again?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Aww, J, P and D. The Three Amigos. Ah, it warms my heart. Hey, what do you say, when I get back from out honeymoon, the three of us have a conference room meeting just for fun? [pause] What is that meaningful look?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what? Maybe we should talk.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey, come here. You guys need to see this.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on the computer] You’re probably sitting there wondering what will be your mark. What will you be known for? It might surprise you to learn...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I finally feel ready. Athlead is growing…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Athleap.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: And Jim can jump back in without skipping a beat. We’ll come back to visit. But I think it’s time for us to officially…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, don’t say it. You’re fired! You’re both fired!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight, come on. Don’t end on a bad note.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don’t be an idiot. It’s for the severance. The best I can do one month for every year you’ve been here. That’s the max.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thanks Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, and if you’re ever in Austin...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Woah. Right. For what, the art? The music? The incredible nightlife? No thank you. But if you’re ever in the area, you’ll always have a place to stay…in my barn.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do I get along with my co-workers? Well, first of all, I don’t have co-workers anymore, I have subordinates. So… have I gotten along with my subordinates? Let’s see. My supplier relations rep, Meredith Palmer, is the only person I know who knows how to properly head bang to Motorhead. Oscar Martinez, my accountant, is now godfather to my son. Angela Schrute, my former accountant is now my wife. My top salesman, Jim Halpert was best man at my wedding and office administrator Pamela Beesley Halpert is my best friend. So…yes. I’d say I have gotten along with my subordinates.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on computer] You might feel sorry for me but I actually feel sorry for you. Because you’re about to leave Cornell. So say it with me: [all]: Oh, I can so just sit here and cry.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, Yes!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You did good. Real good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thanks Dad…Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I spent so much of my time here at Dunder Mifflin thinking about my old pals, my college a cappella group. The weird thing is now, I’m exactly where I wanna be. I got my dream job at Cornell and I’m still just thinking about my old pals. Only now they’re the ones I made here. I wish there was a way to know you’re in the good old days before you’ve actually left them. [pause] Someone should write a song about that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You take something ordinary, like a piece of paper. It’s not much. But if you see it in the right way…And that’s what you did with this documentary. But seriously, you made a nine-year documentary and you couldn’t once show me doing my origami.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [walking out of the bathroom discovered by all] Uh..ohh!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [playing guitar and singing] I saw a friend today. It had been a while. And we forgot each others names. But it didn’t matter. ‘Cause deep inside the feeling still remained the same…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Imagine going back and watching a tape of your life. You could see yourself change and make mistakes…and grow up. You could watch yourself fall in love, watch yourself become a husband, become a father. You guys gave that to me. And that’s…an amazing gift.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hey, Jim, remember flonkerton when you did Office Olympics? It was awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks Phyl.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I still have my medal from that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Do you even have a mattress?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: No, but I still have my medal from that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oscar. Oscar. [crying] I think I’m gay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Why do you say that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [sniffles] It’s just that I’m so emotional.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah, but you’re not gay. You’re not gay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, but maybe the reason…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You’re not gay.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [still playing and singing] And all the faces that I know have that same familiar glow. I think I must have known them somewhere once before.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: How did you do it? How did you capture what it was really like? How we felt and how made each other laugh and how we got through the day? How did you do it? Also, how do cameras work?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Everyday when I came into work, all I wanted to do was leave. So why in the world does it feel so hard to leave right now?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: It all seems so very arbitrary. I applied for a job at this company because they were hiring. I took a desk at the back because it was empty. But…[chuckles] no matter how you get there or where you end up, human beings have this miraculous gift to make that place home. [standing with two cops] Let’s do this.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I just feel lucky that I got a chance to share my crummy story with anyone out there who thinks they’re the only one to take a dump in a paper shredder. You’re not alone sister. Let’s get a beer sometime.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I’m happy that this was all filmed so I can remember everyone and what we did. I worked for a paper company all these years and I never wrote anything down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I sold paper at this company for 12 years. My job was to speak to clients on the phone about quantities and types of copier paper. Even if I didn’t love every minute of it, everything I have, I owe to this job. This stupid…wonderful…boring…amazing job.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I thought it was weird when you picked us to make a documentary. But all in all…I think an ordinary paper company like Dunder Mifflin was a great subject for a documentary. There’s a lot of beauty in ordinary things. Isn’t that kind of the point?
